definition: spirit trembling with excitement (idiom); in high spirits/lively and full of enthusiasm/full of energy/con brio
essence/extract/vitality/energy/semen/sperm/mythical goblin spirit/highly perfected/elite/the pick of sth/proficient (refined ability)/extremely (fine)/selected rice (archaic)
God/abbr. for 神舟[Shen2 zhou1]
deity/soul/spirit/unusual/mysterious/lively/expressive/expression/look/CL:個|个[ge4]/(slang) awesome/amazing
to tremble/to shake out/to reveal/to make it in the world
shake/trembling

sentences.english: You might drink more later in the morning, to keep yourself energized.
sentences.chinese: 上午稍晚一点你会喝更多，为了让自己精神抖擞。

sentences.english: The man stepped off in good spirits.
sentences.chinese: 士兵们精神抖擞地齐步走。

sentences.english: Lemonade on a hot day is very refreshing.
sentences.chinese: 在暑天喝柠檬水，会使人精神抖擞。

sentences.english: The horse perked up its head.
sentences.chinese: 那匹马精神抖擞地昂起头来。

sentences.english: During the morning walk, I’m able to mentally prepare for my workday.
sentences.chinese: 当早晨散步时，我会精神抖擞地准备好工作的一天。

sentences.english: Do things that you inspire you daily.
sentences.chinese: 做那些能让你每天精神抖擞的事。

sentences.english: The king got up and was surprised to see Nasreddin in high sprits.
sentences.chinese: 国王起床后，看到纳斯雷丁精神抖擞，就吃了一惊。

sentences.english: The goal setting process gets employees energized and excited.
sentences.chinese: 设定目标的过程要让员工精神抖擞，兴奋不已。

sentences.english: During the joy immediately like in a man in good spirits.
sentences.chinese: 喜得李世民立即像是换了一个人一样精神抖擞。
我的精神抖擞可让你烦恼？

definition: full of vigor (idiom)/lively/in high spirits
in high spirits (idiom); glowing with health and vigor
in great spirits/to have great vitality
in glowing spirits (idiom); bursting with life/radiating health and vigor
lit. vitality a hundredfold (idiom); refreshed/one's vigor thoroughly restored
having high fighting spirit
in high spirits (idiom); glowing with health and vigor
lit. lively dragon and animated tiger (idiom)/fig. vigorous and lively
to rouse/to invigorate/to enliven/to put sb into high spirits/con brio
vigorous/energetic
(idiom) full of vitality/relaxed and alert
face glowing (idiom); looking radiant/all smiles
head high, chest out (idiom); to keep up one's spirits/in fine mettle (of animal)
brimming with confidence (idiom)
dispirited and downcast (idiom); listless/in low spirits/washed out
to gather one's spirits/to pull oneself together
